definitions.title: abstr.
definitions.body: (Sta:§ 324 b) sudden blindness (etym. dub.; der. fr. [[נוּר]] highly improb., whether antiphr. Wetzst:De Psalm Ps 4, 886 Kö:ii. 1, 404, or fr. dazzling, cf. ‘ flimmern ’ Hoffm:ZAW ii (1882), 68; but also view of Hal:RÉJ xi. 66 deriv. fr. √ [[סנר]] cover with a skin, i.e. produce film over, lacks demonstration; at present we must be content with assuming quadrilit. √, Thes Sta:§ 243);—´[[הִכּוּ בַּסּ]] Ge 19:11 (J) they smote the men with sudden blindness, cf. 2Ki 6:18, 2Ki 6:18 (all cases miraculous, and in K temporary).
